thread.title: Volunteer coach for girls' basketball team faces sex charges
thread.title_full: Volunteer coach for girls' basketball team faces sex charges

title: Volunteer coach for girls' basketball team faces sex charges
text:
Volunteer coach for girls’ basketball team faces sex charges By - Associated   
DETROIT (AP) - A volunteer basketball coach at a Detroit high school has been charged with having inappropriate sexual contact with a 15-year-old student in a car outside her home. 
Prosecutors say 25-year-old Kevin Orr-Mathews is to be arraigned Wednesday on first- and third-degree criminal sexual conduct charges. 
Mathews worked last month with the girls’ basketball team at Henry Ford High School. The 15-year-old was not on the team at the time. 
Orr-Mathews’ case was not listed in court records and The Associated Press was unable to determine if he has an attorney. 
Henry Ford is part of the Education Achievement Authority, Michigan’s turnaround district for low-performing public schools. 
A district spokesman says a complaint was made to another member of the team’s coaching staff who contacted school officials. Police then were notified.
